title: Getting Started with typeR
text: Welcome typeR package! vignette, ‚Äôll learn install package, ‚Äôs designed , use core functionality. Whether ‚Äôre beginner advanced R user, guide help get started right foot. package designed simulate typing effects R scripts presentations tutorials.

title: Getting Started with typeR
text: haven‚Äôt already, can install package. soon becomes available CRAN: Install development version GitHub: installation, load package:
code: install.packages("typeR") # Install devtools package if not already installed if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("devtools") }  # Install from GitHub devtools::install_github("fgazzelloni/typeR") library(typeR)

title: Getting Started with typeR
text: Let‚Äôs dive simple example show typeR works practice.

what: Example with a custom R script
title: Getting Started with typeR
text: typeR() function can simulate typing R script line line R console. ‚Äôs basic example: ‚Äôs output looks like:
code: library(typeR)  # Create a test script for demonstration writeLines(c(   "# Testing typeR",   "x <- 1:10",   "y <- x*2",   "plot(x, y)" ), "test_script.R")  # Simulate typing the script typeR("test_script.R", delay = 0.05)

title: Getting Started with typeR
text: live code execution typing animation, see dedicated vignette: vignette covers use typeRun() function, types executes R code real-time. Check function reference documentation details available parameters usage.
code: vignette("typerun-demo", package = "typeR")

title: Getting Started with typeR
text: Now ‚Äôre running typeR, suggestions learning: Explore package documentation: ?typeR Check vignettes tutorials advanced topics. Contribute share feature ideas via GitHub Issues link.

title: Getting Started with typeR
text: Thanks using typeR package! Feedback contributions always welcome. encounter issues suggestions, feel free reach https://github.com/Fgazzelloni/typeR. Happy coding! Federica

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
text: typeRun() enhanced version typeR() simulates typing animation also executes R code real-time. makes perfect : üéì Live teaching workshops üé§ Conference presentations üìπ Recording tutorials üß™ Interactive demonstrations

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
text: basic usage run R script typing animation live execution: ‚Äôll see: - Code types character character - line executes ‚Äôs typed - Results appear immediately command
code: # Create a simple script cat("# Data Analysis Demo x <- 1:10 mean(x) sum(x) ", file = "demo.R")  # Type and execute it typeRun("demo.R")

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
code: # typeR: Just displays, doesn't execute typeR("demo.R") # Output: Shows the code typing out (no results)  # typeRun: Types AND executes typeRun("demo.R") # Output: Shows code typing + execution results

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
text: Parameters: - delay: Base time characters (seconds) - jitter: Random variation natural feel
code: # Slower typing for dramatic effect typeRun("demo.R", delay = 0.1, jitter = 0.02)  # Faster typing for quick demos typeRun("demo.R", delay = 0.02, jitter = 0.005)

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
text: long outputs, control much displayed:
code: cat(" # Long vector long_vec <- 1:1000 long_vec  # Large data frame big_df <- mtcars[rep(1:32, 10), ] big_df ", file = "long_output.R")  # Show only first 5 elements/rows typeRun("long_output.R", max_print = 5)

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
text: happens: - model <- lm(...) executes silently (output) - summary(model) displays full summary coefficients, R-squared, etc.
code: cat(" # Linear regression model <- lm(mpg ~ hp + wt, data = mtcars) summary(model) ", file = "model_demo.R")  typeRun("model_demo.R")

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
text: typeRun() handles model types intelligently:
code: cat(" # Logistic regression glm_model <- glm(am ~ hp + wt, data = mtcars, family = binomial) summary(glm_model)  # Poisson regression pois_model <- glm(carb ~ mpg, data = mtcars, family = poisson) summary(pois_model) ", file = "glm_demo.R")  typeRun("glm_demo.R")

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
text: execution, full control: Press ESC (Ctrl+C) pause ‚Äôll see: Enter choice (1 resume 2 stop): Enter 1 continue paused Enter 2 stop completely perfect : - Answering questions presentations - Explaining specific code sections - Debugging demonstrations
code: typeRun("long_script.R") # Press ESC while running # Enter 1 to resume # Or enter 2 to stop

previous_headings: Working with R Markdown and Quarto
title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
text: typeRun() intelligently handles .Rmd files: text . ‚Äô, file = ‚Äúreport.Rmd‚Äù) typeRun(‚Äúreport.Rmd‚Äù)
code: # Create an R Markdown example cat('--- title: "Analysis Report" ---  # Introduction  This is narrative text (won\'t execute). # This R code will execute x <- 1:10 mean(x) plot(x, x^2) **Behavior:** - ‚úÖ Types and shows all text - ‚úÖ Executes only R code chunks - ‚úÖ Skips YAML headers - ‚úÖ Preserves narrative flow  ### Quarto Documents  Works identically with `.qmd` files:   ``` r typeRun("analysis.qmd")

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
text: Run code isolated environment keep workspace clean:
code: # Create custom environment my_env <- new.env()  # Run in that environment typeRun("demo.R", envir = my_env)  # Check what was created ls(my_env) ls()  # Your global environment is unchanged

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
text: Package loading messages automatically suppressed:
code: cat(" library(ggplot2)  # No startup message shown library(dplyr)    # Clean output  # But code works normally mtcars %>% head() ", file = "packages.R")  typeRun("packages.R") # Shows only the actual results, not package messages

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
text: don‚Äôt produce output (cleaner demos):
code: cat(" # Assignments - silent x <- 1:10 y <- mean(x)  # Plots - execute but don't clutter console plot(x, y) hist(x)  # Package loading - no startup messages library(stats) ", file = "silent.R")  typeRun("silent.R")

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
code: cat(" # Direct values 1:10          # Shows the vector  # Function calls mean(1:10)    # Shows: [1] 5.5  # Print statements print('Hello') # Shows: [1] 'Hello'  # Model summaries summary(lm(mpg ~ hp, data = mtcars))  # Shows full summary ", file = "visible.R")  typeRun("visible.R")

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
code: cat(" # Load data data(mtcars) head(mtcars, 3)  # Visualize relationship plot(mtcars$hp, mtcars$mpg,      xlab = 'Horsepower',      ylab = 'Miles per Gallon',      main = 'MPG vs Horsepower')  # Fit model model <- lm(mpg ~ hp, data = mtcars) summary(model)  # Add regression line abline(model, col = 'red', lwd = 2)  # Predictions new_data <- data.frame(hp = c(100, 150, 200)) predict(model, new_data) ", file = "teaching_demo.R")  typeRun("teaching_demo.R", delay = 0.08)

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
code: cat(" # 1. Load and explore data <- iris str(data)  # 2. Summary statistics summary(data)  # 3. Visualization boxplot(Sepal.Length ~ Species, data = data,         main = 'Sepal Length by Species',         col = c('lightblue', 'lightgreen', 'pink'))  # 4. Statistical test aov_result <- aov(Sepal.Length ~ Species, data = data) summary(aov_result)  # 5. Post-hoc test TukeyHSD(aov_result) ", file = "analysis_demo.R")  typeRun("analysis_demo.R", delay = 0.06, max_print = 8)

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
code: cat(" # Binary outcome: Manual transmission (am) # Predictors: HP and weight  # Fit logistic regression logit_model <- glm(am ~ hp + wt,                     data = mtcars,                     family = binomial(link = 'logit'))  # Model summary summary(logit_model)  # Odds ratios exp(coef(logit_model))  # Predicted probabilities mtcars$pred_prob <- predict(logit_model, type = 'response') head(mtcars[, c('am', 'hp', 'wt', 'pred_prob')]) ", file = "glm_example.R")  typeRun("glm_example.R", max_print = 6)

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
text: presenting:
code: # Test your script normally first source("demo.R")  # Then test with typeRun typeRun("demo.R")

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
code: # For 5-minute demos: ~0.05 delay typeRun("demo.R", delay = 0.05)  # For dramatic reveals: ~0.1 delay typeRun("demo.R", delay = 0.1)  # For quick reviews: ~0.02 delay typeRun("demo.R", delay = 0.02)

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
code: # Lots of output? Limit it typeRun("demo.R", max_print = 5)  # Models in script? They'll show nicely # Plots in script? They'll render silently

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
code: # Good: One concept per script typeRun("01_data_loading.R") typeRun("02_visualization.R") typeRun("03_modeling.R")  # Less good: One giant script typeRun("everything.R")  # Too long, hard to control

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
code: # Error: The file does not exist typeRun("missing.R")  # Solution: Check file path file.exists("demo.R") list.files(pattern = "\\.R$")

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
code: # If output looks wrong, test the script normally first source("demo.R")  # Then try with typeRun typeRun("demo.R")

title: Live Code Execution with typeRun
code: # Press ESC, then enter 2 # Or press Ctrl+C (on some systems)

what: typeR - Typing Animation for R Code
title: typeR - Typing Animation for R Code
text: typeR R package simulates typing effects R script files, making ideal live coding presentations, interactive teaching, creating animations.

title: typeR - Typing Animation for R Code
text: install development version typeR GitHub, use:
code: # Install devtools if you don't already have it install.packages("devtools")  # Install typeR from GitHub devtools::install_github("fgazzelloni/typeR")

title: typeR - Typing Animation for R Code
text: ‚Äôs example use typeR package:
code: library(typeR)  # Create a test script for demonstration writeLines(c(   "# Testing typeR",   "x <- 1:10",   "y <- x*2",   "plot(x, y)" ), "test_script.R")  # Simulate typing the script typeR("test_script.R", delay = 0.05)

title: typeR - Typing Animation for R Code
text: Simulates typing R script files line line. Adjustable typing speed using delay parameter. Creates engaging live coding demonstrations.

title: typeR - Typing Animation for R Code
text: Contributions welcome! Please open issue submit pull request.

text: package simulate typing R script files presentations demonstrations.

what: Simulate Typing of an R Script File ‚Äî typeR
title: Simulate Typing of an R Script File ‚Äî typeR
text: Simulates typing content R script file, line line, character character, create animation effect live coding presentations educational demonstrations.

title: Simulate Typing of an R Script File ‚Äî typeR
code: typeR(file, delay = 0.05)

title: Simulate Typing of an R Script File ‚Äî typeR
text: file Path R script file simulate typing. delay delay (seconds) typing character (default: 0.05).

title: Simulate Typing of an R Script File ‚Äî typeR
code: # Simulate typing of a script # typeR("example_script.R", delay = 0.1)

what: Type and Run R Code with Live Evaluation ‚Äî typeRun
title: Type and Run R Code with Live Evaluation ‚Äî typeRun
text: enhanced version typeR simulates typing also evaluates R code real-time.  Supports interactive pause/resume control handles Quarto/R Markdown documents plain R scripts.

title: Type and Run R Code with Live Evaluation ‚Äî typeRun
code: typeRun(   file,   delay = 0.05,   jitter = 0.01,   max_print = 10,   envir = new.env(parent = .GlobalEnv) )

title: Type and Run R Code with Live Evaluation ‚Äî typeRun
text: file Character string. Path R script (.R), R Markdown (.Rmd), Quarto (.qmd) file type execute. delay Numeric. Base delay seconds typing character. Default 0.05 (50 milliseconds). jitter Numeric. Standard deviation random variation typing speed, adding natural typing rhythm. Default 0.01. max_print Integer. Maximum number elements print long outputs (vectors, data frames, matrices, lists). Default 10. envir Environment. environment evaluate R code. Default new environment global environment parent.

title: Type and Run R Code with Live Evaluation ‚Äî typeRun
text: Invisibly returns NULL. Called side effects (typing animation code evaluation).

title: Type and Run R Code with Live Evaluation ‚Äî typeRun
text: typeRun() extends basic typeR() functionality : Live Code Evaluation:  Executes R code chunks typed Interactive Control: Press ESC/Ctrl+C pause, choose resume stop Smart Output: Truncates long outputs handles models intelligently Format Support: Handles .R, .Rmd, .qmd files intelligently Quarto/R Markdown files, typeRun(): Skips YAML headers evaluates code R code chunks Preserves narrative text without evaluation R scripts, evaluates non-comment, non-empty lines.

title: Type and Run R Code with Live Evaluation ‚Äî typeRun
text: Assignments plotting functions execute silently Long vectors/data frames truncated max_print elements Model summaries (lm, glm, etc.) display using R's standard print methods Raw model objects (without summary call) show simple fitted message Package loading messages (library/require) suppressed Errors caught displayed without stopping execution

title: Type and Run R Code with Live Evaluation ‚Äî typeRun
text: execution, can: Press ESC (Ctrl+C systems) pause Enter 1 resume paused Enter 2 stop completely

title: Type and Run R Code with Live Evaluation ‚Äî typeRun
code:
if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Type and run a simple R script typeRun("analysis.R")  # Type and run with slower, more dramatic effect typeRun("demo.R", delay = 0.1, jitter = 0.02)  # Type and run a Quarto document with limited output typeRun("report.qmd", max_print = 5)  # Use a specific environment for evaluation my_env <- new.env() typeRun("script.R", envir = my_env) ls(my_env)  # See what was created  # Create a demo file and run it cat("# Simple Demo
x <- 1:10
mean(x)
plot(x)
", file = "demo.R") typeRun("demo.R") } # }

title: typeR 0.2.0
text: Executes R code real-time types Interactive pause/resume control (press ESC) Smart output handling truncation Full support . R, .Rmd, .qmd files Customizable output limits max_print parameter Isolated environment evaluation

title: typeR 0.2.0
text: Reorganized internal helper functions separate files Added comprehensive documentation typeRun() Improved code organization utils-typing.R utils-typerun.R

title: typeR 0.1.0
text: Initial CRAN release typeR() function typing animation R scripts Quarto/RMarkdown files
